name: b.tan Darker Self Tanner Kit | Fall In Love at First Tan Bundle - Darker Self Tan Mousse with Self Tanning Mitt Applicator, Violet Base, 1 Hour Sunless Fast Tanner, No Fake Tan Smell, No Added Nasties, Vegan, Cruelty Free, 6.7 Fl Oz

other_info.Skin Type: All, Oily, Combination, Sensitive, Dry, Normal
other_info.Product Benefits: Hydrating, Radiant Tan, Color Correction, Moisturizing

about_this_item: NO ORANGE TONES. i'm perfect for anyone looking for a medium dark tan with absolutely no orange tones
TANNING MITT INCLUDED. i come with our best selling mitt so you can create the most awesome, dark tan on the planet
1 HOUR CURE TIME. 1 hour development time, leave on for 4+ hours for darker results
PRO TIP: apply a moisturizer to elbows, knees + ankles before application. apply evenly (but not too thick) + blend thoroughly for the perfect bronzed glow. use with a mitt for ultra smooth results.
VEGAN FRIENDLY. i love animals so im 100% cruelty free, vegan friendly, and free of nasties like parabens
MADE IN THE USA: Made by the tanning experts here in the USA. Our state of the art production facilities use only the highest quality ingredients so you know your skin is well looked after.

I found that worked best for me and I liked using the lighter shade to build up instead of go too dark at once.

title: No orange tan
content: I have been using another brand of self tanner with a violet base for the past 4 years but it was nearly $40 a bottle and they never offered free shipping. With everything getting more expensive I was looking for a lower priced self tanner that gave me similar results. This is the best one I have found. The price is reasonable and the color has a violet base to combat the orange oompah loompah look. I will say it does dry my skin out a little but I have just started putting on lotion after I rinse the tanner off. I took off one star because it dries my skin out. The spray has been nice too. It never seems to be extremely dark but it does give a bit of color. The rose water mist is hydrating and it doesn’t smell terrible either. I use it on my face, neck, and chest before applying moisturizer or makeup. Just let it dry before applying anything else to your skin, it dries relatively quickly. I like that you can spray it where sun would hit naturally to create a more realistic tan look.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I was getting ready for a trip to the Galapagos Islands, and thought it might be a good idea to try to give my pale white skin a head start for all the sun that was waiting for me. So after looking into this chemical tanning situation and reading dozens of reviews for dozens of products, I settled on this stuff. I am a moderately hairy male with dry skin, and I admit I did not follow the first (what seemed very important) step of exfoliating...I am not sure even how to go about that! So one morning I got out the very nice mitt and the sprayed some of the thick foam onto the thing and got started. It spread very easily over my arms and legs, and did not smell...too bad! I let it dry then put on my clothes and basically let it develop for around 8 hours. I then washed it off with my outdoor hose, carefully showered that night not soaping my arms and legs, and by the morning I had some legit color! So I let it go a day or two, and then re-applied another coat, following the same procedure and did not follow the directions of avoiding too much on the knees and other bony protrusions, so my tan deepened but my knees were too dark. So with a really ok medium-light tan after 2 doses, off to the equator I went! After two weeks, and with the use of a 30 spf sunscreen I came back a bit lighter than when I left, so I reapplied another couple of treatments when I returned, avoiding my knees this time, and I really again achieved a very nice tan! My adult children actually commented on how good my tan looked from the trip (I did not tell them how I really got the tan!) At any rate, this stuff actually does work. Very easy even for a novice like me to put the foam on in a reasonable manner to achieve the color I wanted. I have to say I am very pleasantly surprised!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: Initially, I was nervous to use this self tanner as it came out grey. I’ve only ever used the Jergens Mousse Self Tanner and it’s a dark brown color. The grey didn’t necessarily guide me on where and where I had not tanned yet, but it’s pretty easy for me to get everywhere without a guide. The smell wasn’t too pungent, it smelled like alcohol wipes at first and did have a typical self tanner smell but nothing too crazy. And it wasn’t sticky after drying. I bought the “I want the darkest tan possible” and I left it on for 12+ hours. It gave me a nice VERY LIGHT color. I’m already fair skinned so I was expecting to be super tan but no, it’s very natural, not orange and barely gave me color. No worries, but for the tan I bought I would’ve assumed I would’ve got darker. I’m not a fan of putting 2 or 3+ coats on, I feel as if that defeats the purpose but if you want a darker color definitely do a couple coats. Overall, I’m not disappointed but I’m also not happy. I would buy this product again, especially for being such a good price. I wish I would’ve taken before and after photos to show the difference but I can only see a small difference where I didn’t tan (such as where my sports bra and shorts were).
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2024

content: Love the color results you get from this gel

title: Tan gel
content: I'm a 2nd time self tan user (ever in my life). I'm always a "research before you do anything" person though because I don't want to mess it up, so per YouTubers... I exfoliated the parts on my body I was using the product on really well, shaved, & moisturized the rough patches (elbows, ankles, knees, etc) & I waited after my shower about 30 min so that my skin could cool down and the pores could close.  I'm naturally a very dry skin, so I had some rough patches on my shins that kind of absorbed the product more. I also have bigger pores on my shins, so it's a bit "dotted" (shown in close up pic)  & I have a pretty big scar that also absorbed a lot, but I was able to blend it out with my shower & make-up wipes.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I kept the product on for the 1st hr (see pic) & I could tell my skin color had changed, but it was kind of pale/ grey. So I applied a second coat & left it on overnight (approximately 14 hrs total) & I did use a tad bit (1 coat) on my face & it's a bit patchy as well, but I'm not too worried about that cause I have make up.  Overall, I like the color I got.  I'll probably rinse off and reapply one more time to my legs since they're still lighter than my arms, but I really like the color. It's not "orange" & you just have to keep adding layers to get your desired color.  The pics don't showcase it very well & please don't mind my bedhead & "just woke up" face. I hope this review helps anyone wanting to try it out.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2024

title: Verified Purchase

title: Was perfect!
content: I’ve lived in Florida all my life so I have skin damage. I have white spots on my arms and legs that don’t tan. This helps to even out my skin tone in the summer. I exfoliate and use the mitt along with gloves. It rubs in evenly and I use what’s left on the mitt around the feet,ankles, knees and elbows. I’m surprised how tan I get since this product is next to the lowest tan level. The con is that it takes more than 4 hours to get tan and then take a shower to wash it off. It does transfer to clothing before you wash it off. After a shower pat dry or it comes off on the towel. I have to reapply once a week. In between it fades but doesn’t get blotchy. Be aware that it can make random moles or skin tags overly dark. Overall great product.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2024

title: So far so good!
content: This foam gives medium color and I feel like the longer it's left on, the darker it gets. It does have an odor, (hence the 4 stars) but if you follow directions and shower several hours after (with no soap) the smell goes away.  Typically, I shower and exfoliate, put lotion on after I towel dry, wait a few minutes, then apply tanning foam. After 3-4 hours, I hop back into the shower and rinse, dry, and apply my Bath and Body Works lotion. Usually apply twice a week for a medium tan.

title: Verified Purchase
content: I don’t usually write reviews, but if you’re thinking about buying this — do it! I used to tan naturally and very quickly, all the way through high school. However, when I got a little older (19-20), it stopped. I’ve tried to tan for years now and have never gotten the result I was so used to as a kid and teenager. My self confidence had plummeted. I decided this year I was going to try self-tanning, and I’m so glad I did!!! I feel more confident and I look healthier. It’s not orange, or even orange tinted, and it looks incredibly close to my skin tone. I only took one star off because I think it smells horrible, but that’s just me.

title: Good quick tan
content: Product is difficult toget out of the bottle. I like the way the foam spreads on the skin but for something f that’s meant to be practical I’m not happy with all the work it takes to get the product in the glove. That’s the only reason for the three stars.  Otherwise it’s my first day using the product and I have no review on the color or development.

title: Verified Purchase
content: Even when applied evenly i seem to still end up blotchy. I thought once it dried there was no need to worry about rubbing against things but it seems I was wrong. The spray left my face extremely dry the next day. When it drys correctly and doesn’t blotch it has a nice glow.
